title: 108_s549
content: The Act titled "World Trade Center Bombing Victims Compensation Act of 2003" references the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund of 2001 for compensation of victims of terrorist acts. The Act "World Trade Center Bombing Victims Compensation Act of 2003" is amended to include references to the bombing of the World Trade Center in 1993 for eligibility and compensation determination. The Act is amended to limit the timeframe for filing claims and include references to the 1993 World Trade Center bombing for eligibility and compensation determination. The Act is amended to include references to the 1993 World Trade Center bombing for eligibility and compensation determination. The Act is amended to include limitations on civil actions related to the 1993 World Trade Center bombing. Claimants waive the right to file civil actions for damages in federal or state courts, except for certain circumstances. The Act limits civil actions related to the 1993 World Trade Center bombing. Claimants involved in a conspiracy to commit a terrorist act cannot submit a claim under this title. Individuals with prior compensation may not be eligible for compensation. An individual is not eligible for compensation under this subsection if they have received compensation from a civil action related to the 1993 World Trade Center bombing, unless the compensation was received from a civil action against a knowing participant in a terrorist act conspiracy. Individuals involved in the 1993 World Trade Center bombing are ineligible for compensation under this title. The Attorney General, in consultation with the Special Master, will create regulations within 90 days of the Act's enactment to implement the amendments. This includes forms for submitting claims, required information, hearing procedures, assistance for claim filing, and other relevant matters.
